channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Iran overturns rapper Toomaj Salehi's death sentence for criticizing the government
item.description: The rapper came to fame over his lyrics about the death in police custody of Mahsa Amini in 2022. Iran's Supreme Court ruled the sentence was more than what is allowed by the law.
item.content:encoded:
The rapper came to fame over his lyrics about the death in police custody of Mahsa Amini in 2022. Iran's Supreme Court ruled the sentence was more than what is allowed by the law.

(Image credit: Ebrahim Noroozi)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Supermajority podcast explores life after the Covenant School mass shooting
item.description: Supermajority is a new series from NPR's Embedded. It follows three mothers of students who survived the 2023 Covenant School shooting in Nashville, T ...
item.content:encoded: Supermajority is a new series from NPR's Embedded. It follows three mothers of students who survived the 2023 Covenant School shooting in Nashville, T ...

item.title: Heat wave continues to boil the Midwest and East Coast while storms brew behind it
item.description: As the heat is expected to ease off, heavy rain, strong winds and some tornados are in the forecast for parts of the Midwest and the Northeast. Meanwhile, the heat wave is reaching into the South.
item.content:encoded:
As the heat is expected to ease off, heavy rain, strong winds and some tornados are in the forecast for parts of the Midwest and the Northeast. Meanwhile, the heat wave is reaching into the South.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Historian reflects on US Constitution, 236 years after it first went into effect
item.description: NPR's Adrian Florido talks with Harvard history professor Jill Lepore about the state of the U.S. Constitution, 236 years after its ratification.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Adrian Florido talks with Harvard history professor Jill Lepore about the state of the U.S. Constitution, 236 years after its ratification.
item.dc:creator: Adrian Florido

item.title: As the Supreme Court term nears its end, a number of decisions remain
item.description: The Supreme Court has a large number of major cases left to decide, and only days left to do it.
item.content:encoded: The Supreme Court has a large number of major cases left to decide, and only days left to do it.
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson

item.title: The USS Dwight D. Eisenhower leaves the Red Sea as Houthi attacks continue
item.description: The Eisenhower led a task force in response against Houthi attacks on shipping in the Red Sea and Gulf of Aden. The carrier USS Theodore Roosevelt will deploy to the region to maintain a presence.
item.content:encoded:
The Eisenhower led a task force in response against Houthi attacks on shipping in the Red Sea and Gulf of Aden. The carrier USS Theodore Roosevelt will deploy to the region to maintain a presence.

(Image credit: Bernat Armangue)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Energy prices are at zero to negative â€” but consumers aren't getting the benefits
item.description: Energy prices are low - so low, in fact, that they are in negative territory. But those savings aren't trickling down to consumers.
item.content:encoded: Energy prices are low - so low, in fact, that they are in negative territory. But those savings aren't trickling down to consumers.
item.dc:creator: Don Gonyea

item.title: Equality PAC raises millions to boost LGBTQ representation in Congress
item.description: We look at the Equality Caucus in the US Congress, which aims to increase representation in elected offices and pass laws protecting the LGBTQ community. (Story first aired on ATC on June 21.)
item.content:encoded: We look at the Equality Caucus in the US Congress, which aims to increase representation in elected offices and pass laws protecting the LGBTQ community. (Story first aired on ATC on June 21.)
item.dc:creator: Barbara Sprunt

item.title: France's far right is gaining momentum for the first time since World War II
item.description: The political landscape in France is shifting, with a far right party continuing to gain momentum ahead of the country's snap parliamentary elections later this month.
item.content:encoded: The political landscape in France is shifting, with a far right party continuing to gain momentum ahead of the country's snap parliamentary elections later this month.
item.dc:creator: Don Gonyea

item.title: Taco prices are going up in Mexico and a certain soapy herb is to blame
item.description: A cilantro shortage has lead to a spike in price for the herb - and that is making tacos more expensive in Mexico.
item.content:encoded: A cilantro shortage has lead to a spike in price for the herb - and that is making tacos more expensive in Mexico.
item.dc:creator: Emily Green
